intro: Cacalia purpurascens, commonly known as the purplestem thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces showy purple to pink flowers. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a serrated edge, while the stem is often reddish in color. Cacalia purpurascens is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
